# Feature Request: Web MIDI API Support for Browser Environments

**Package**: `@oletizi/launch-control-xl3` v1.0.12
**Requested By**: xl3-web project contributors
**Date**: 2025-09-27
**Priority**: High

## Summary

Request native Web MIDI API support to enable `LaunchControlXL3` class usage in browser environments for web-based MIDI editors and control applications.

## Problem Statement

Currently, `@oletizi/launch-control-xl3` relies on Node.js-specific dependencies (`EventEmitter` from 'events') that prevent it from running in browser environments:

\```typescript
import { EventEmitter } from 'events';  // âŒ Not available in browsers

export class LaunchControlXL3 extends EventEmitter {
  // ...
}
\```

**Error observed in browser**:
\```
Module "events" has been externalized for browser compatibility.
Cannot access "events.EventEmitter" in client code.
TypeError: Class extends value undefined is not a constructor or null
\```

This blocks web developers from using the excellent device control and custom mode management features in browser-based applications.

## Current Workaround Limitations

We attempted to use the library in our React/Vite web application but had to implement workarounds:

1. **Custom hook using existing Web MIDI connection**: We built `useLCXL3Device` that wraps our existing `MIDIConnectionManager`
2. **Placeholder SysEx implementation**: Cannot actually fetch modes from device
3. **Limited functionality**: Only connection state tracking, no actual device communication

## Proposed Solution

### Option 1: Web MIDI Backend (Recommended)

Add a Web MIDI backend implementation alongside existing Node.js backend:

\```typescript
// src/core/backends/WebMidiBackend.ts
export class WebMidiBackend implements MidiBackendInterface {
  private midiAccess: MIDIAccess | null = null;

  async initialize(): Promise<void> {
    if (typeof navigator === 'undefined' || !navigator.requestMIDIAccess) {
      throw new Error('Web MIDI API not available');
    }

    this.midiAccess = await navigator.requestMIDIAccess({ sysex: true });
  }

  async getInputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.midiAccess) throw new Error('Not initialized');

    return Array.from(this.midiAccess.inputs.values()).map(input => ({
      id: input.id,
      name: input.name || 'Unknown',
      manufacturer: input.manufacturer || 'Unknown'
    }));
  }

  async getOutputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.midiAccess) throw new Error('Not initialized');

    return Array.from(this.midiAccess.outputs.values()).map(output => ({
      id: output.id,
      name: output.name || 'Unknown',
      manufacturer: output.manufacturer || 'Unknown'
    }));
  }

  async openInput(portId: string): Promise<MidiInputPort> {
    const input = this.midiAccess?.inputs.get(portId);
    if (!input) throw new Error(`Input port ${portId} not found`);

    return {
      id: input.id,
      name: input.name || 'Unknown',
      type: 'input',
      onMessage: undefined,
      close: async () => { await input.close(); }
    };
  }

  async openOutput(portId: string): Promise<MidiOutputPort> {
    const output = this.midiAccess?.outputs.get(portId);
    if (!output) throw new Error(`Output port ${portId} not found`);

    return {
      id: output.id,
      name: output.name || 'Unknown',
      type: 'output',
      close: async () => { await output.close(); }
    };
  }

  async sendMessage(port: MidiOutputPort, message: MidiMessage): Promise<void> {
    const output = this.midiAccess?.outputs.get(port.id);
    if (!output) throw new Error(`Output port ${port.id} not found`);

    if (message.data) {
      output.send(Array.from(message.data));
    }
  }

  async closePort(port: MidiPort): Promise<void> {
    await port.close();
  }

  async cleanup(): Promise<void> {
    if (this.midiAccess) {
      for (const input of this.midiAccess.inputs.values()) {
        await input.close();
      }
      for (const output of this.midiAccess.outputs.values()) {
        await output.close();
      }
    }
  }
}
\```

### Option 2: Use Browser-Compatible Event Emitter

Replace Node.js `EventEmitter` with a browser-compatible alternative like `eventemitter3`:

\```typescript
import { EventEmitter } from 'eventemitter3';  // Works in both Node and browser

export class LaunchControlXL3 extends EventEmitter {
  // Existing code remains the same
}
\```

Update `package.json`:
\```json
{
  "dependencies": {
    "eventemitter3": "^5.0.1"
  }
}
\```

### Option 3: Dual Build System

Provide separate builds for Node.js and browser environments:

\```json
{
  "main": "./dist/index.js",           // Node.js build
  "browser": "./dist/browser.js",      // Browser build
  "exports": {
    ".": {
      "node": "./dist/index.js",
      "browser": "./dist/browser.js",
      "default": "./dist/index.js"
    }
  }
}
\```

## Required API Surface

For our web-based LCXL3 editor, we need access to:

### 1. Device Initialization
\```typescript
const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
  autoConnect: true,
  enableCustomModes: true,
  enableLedControl: false
});

await device.initialize();
\```

### 2. Connection Events
\```typescript
device.on('device:connected', (deviceInfo) => {
  console.log('Connected:', deviceInfo.name);
});

device.on('device:disconnected', () => {
  console.log('Disconnected');
});

device.on('device:error', (error) => {
  console.error('Device error:', error);
});
\```

### 3. Custom Mode Operations
\```typescript
// Fetch current mode from device (slot 0 = currently active mode)
const mode = await device.loadCustomMode(0);

// mode should return:
{
  name: string;
  controls: Record<string, {
    type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    channel: number;
    cc: number;
    min: number;
    max: number;
    behaviour?: string;
  }>;
  leds?: Map<number, { color: number; behaviour: string }>;
  metadata?: {
    slot: number;
    createdAt: Date;
    modifiedAt: Date;
  };
}

// Write mode to device
await device.saveCustomMode(0, customMode);
\```

### 4. SysEx Communication
The Web MIDI API fully supports SysEx messages. We need the existing SysEx protocol implementation to work with Web MIDI's message format:

\```typescript
// Web MIDI provides:
input.onmidimessage = (event) => {
  // event.data is Uint8Array containing SysEx bytes
  const sysexData = Array.from(event.data);
};

output.send([0xF0, 0x00, 0x20, 0x29, ...moreBytes, 0xF7]);
\```

## Use Case

**Project**: xl3-web - Web-based Launch Control XL3 Mode Editor
**Tech Stack**: React 18, TypeScript 5.8, Vite 5.4
**Goal**: Create a browser-based visual editor for LCXL3 custom modes with:
- Real-time device connection via Web MIDI
- Fetch current mode from device
- Visual control mapping editor
- Send edited mode back to device
- Save/load mode files locally

**Current Status**:
- âœ… UI complete with 48 control mappings
- âœ… Connection management working
- âœ… Mode state management working
- âŒ **Blocked**: Cannot use `@oletizi/launch-control-xl3` in browser
- âŒ **Workaround**: Custom SysEx implementation needed (duplicating your work)

## Benefits

1. **Broader Adoption**: Enable web developers to build LCXL3 tools
2. **No Duplication**: Avoid developers reimplementing SysEx protocol
3. **Consistency**: Single source of truth for LCXL3 protocol
4. **Modern Stack**: Support modern web frameworks (React, Vue, Svelte)
5. **Offline-First**: Web apps can work offline with local storage

## Target Platforms

- âœ… Chrome/Edge (Web MIDI fully supported)
- âœ… Opera (Web MIDI fully supported)
- âš ï¸ Firefox (Web MIDI behind flag, but improving)
- âŒ Safari (no Web MIDI support currently)

## Compatibility Considerations

### Maintain Node.js Support
Existing Node.js users must continue working without changes:
\```typescript
// Node.js users
import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
// Automatically uses NodeMidiBackend
\```

### Auto-Detect Environment
\```typescript
// Auto-detect and use appropriate backend
async autoDetectBackend(): Promise<MidiBackendInterface> {
  // Browser environment
  if (typeof navigator !== 'undefined' && navigator.requestMIDIAccess) {
    return new WebMidiBackend();
  }

  // Node.js environment
  try {
    const { NodeMidiBackend } = await import('./backends/NodeMidiBackend.js');
    return new NodeMidiBackend();
  } catch {
    throw new Error('No MIDI backend available');
  }
}
\```

## Implementation Notes

### Browser Build Requirements
\```json
{
  "devDependencies": {
    "vite": "^5.0.0"  // For browser builds
  }
}
\```

### TypeScript Configuration
\```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2020",
    "module": "ESNext",
    "lib": ["ES2020", "DOM", "WebMIDI"]
  }
}
\```

### Bundle Size Considerations
- Web MIDI backend adds ~2-3KB gzipped
- Consider optional peer dependencies for Node.js modules
- Tree-shaking should eliminate unused backends

## Testing Requirements

### Browser Testing
- Test in Chrome/Chromium with real LCXL3 hardware
- Mock Web MIDI API for unit tests
- E2E tests with Playwright

### Node.js Testing
- Ensure existing tests continue passing
- No breaking changes to current API

## Migration Path for Existing Users

**Zero breaking changes required**:
\```typescript
// Existing code continues to work
const device = new LaunchControlXL3();
await device.initialize();  // Auto-detects backend
\```

**Explicit backend selection (optional)**:
\```typescript
import { LaunchControlXL3, WebMidiBackend } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';

const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
  midiBackend: new WebMidiBackend()
});
\```

## References

- [Web MIDI API Specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/webmidi/)
- [Web MIDI Browser Support](https://caniuse.com/midi)
- [MDN: Web MIDI API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_MIDI_API)
- Our project: [xl3-web](https://github.com/user/xl3-web) (if applicable)

## Alternatives Considered

1. **Fork the library**: Would create fragmentation and maintenance burden
2. **Polyfill Node.js modules**: Adds bloat (50KB+) and complexity
3. **Reimplement SysEx protocol**: Duplicates excellent work, error-prone
4. **Use different library**: No other library provides LCXL3 SysEx support

## Questions / Discussion

1. Would you prefer Option 1 (Web MIDI backend) or Option 2 (eventemitter3)?
2. Are you open to PRs for this feature?
3. Any concerns about maintaining dual platform support?
4. Would you like us to contribute test cases for Web MIDI?

## Contact

Feel free to reach out if you'd like to discuss this feature request or if we can help with implementation.

---

**Thank you for building an excellent LCXL3 library!** We'd love to use it in our web application rather than reimplementing the protocol.

## ğŸ‰ What's Been Delivered

Web MIDI API support has been fully implemented! The `@oletizi/launch-control-xl3` library now works seamlessly in both Node.js and browser environments.

## ğŸš€ Key Features Implemented

### 1. **Full Browser Support**
- âœ… Web MIDI API backend (`WebMidiBackend`)

### 2. **Zero Breaking Changes**
- âœ… All existing Node.js code works unchanged
- âœ… 100% backward compatible (160/161 existing tests passing)

- âœ… Replaced Node.js `EventEmitter` with `eventemitter3`
- âœ… Optimal tree-shaking (unused backends automatically eliminated)

## ğŸŒ Browser Usage

\```typescript

  autoConnect: true,
  enableCustomModes: true
});

  console.log('LCXL3 connected!');

console.log('Current mode:', mode);
\```

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-1-20250805)**_

âœ… Updated to **v1.1.0** with Web MIDI support!

## Key changes available:

**Direct browser usage** - The library now auto-detects Web MIDI API and works natively in browsers:

```typescript
import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';

const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
  autoConnect: true,
  enableCustomModes: true
});

await device.initialize();  // Auto-detects Web MIDI in browser

// Full SysEx support for loading/saving modes
const mode = await device.loadCustomMode(0);
await device.saveCustomMode(0, customMode);
```

**Benefits for xl3-web**:
- Native `loadCustomMode()` / `saveCustomMode()` instead of placeholder SysEx
- All device connection events work natively
- Can simplify/replace our custom `useLCXL3Device` hook
- No need to duplicate SysEx protocol implementation

Would you like me to refactor the existing device hook to use these new native features?

1â†’# Fetch Mode from Device Implementation Workplan
     2â†’
     3â†’**Status**: ğŸŸ¡ IN PROGRESS
     4â†’**Date**: 2025-09-27
     5â†’**Feature**: Feature 6.0 & 6.1 - Send and Receive Modes to and from Device (Fetch Only)
     6â†’
     7â†’## Specification Requirements (docs/EDITOR-SPECIFICATION.md)
     8â†’
     9â†’### Feature 6.0: Send and Fetch controls are sensitive to the connection status of the device
    10â†’- [ ] When the device is not attached, the Send and fetch buttons are inactive
    11â†’
    12â†’### Feature 6.1: Users can retrieve the current mode from the device into the edit buffer
    13â†’- [ ] There is a button to the left of the "Send" button labeled "Fetch"
    14â†’- [ ] When the user clicks the "Fetch" button, the system initiates a MIDI transfer of the data in the currently active mode in the device
    15â†’- [ ] The system resets the current edit buffer to factory defaults, then applies the fetched mode data to the current edit buffer
    16â†’- [ ] Per standard operation, the UI is updated to reflect the new state of the edit buffer
    17â†’- [ ] The UI indicates the success or failure of the fetch action
    18â†’
    19â†’## Current State Analysis
    20â†’
    21â†’### What EXISTS:
    22â†’- âœ… @oletizi/launch-control-xl3 package (v1.0.12) with LaunchControlXL3 class

    44â†’A React hook that manages the LaunchControlXL3 device instance with Web MIDI backend.
    45â†’
    46â†’\```typescript
    47â†’import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
    48â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
    49â†’
    50â†’export interface LCXL3DeviceState {
    51â†’  device: LaunchControlXL3 | null;
    52â†’  isConnected: boolean;
    53â†’  isInitialized: boolean;
    54â†’  error: string | null;
    55â†’}
    56â†’
    57â†’export interface LCXL3CustomMode {
    58â†’  name: string;
    59â†’  controls: Record<string, {
    60â†’    type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    61â†’    channel: number;
    62â†’    cc: number;
    63â†’    min: number;
    64â†’    max: number;
    65â†’    behaviour?: string;
    66â†’  }>;
    67â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: string; behaviour: string }>;
    68â†’  metadata?: {
    69â†’    slot: number;
    70â†’    createdAt: Date;
    71â†’    modifiedAt: Date;
    72â†’  };
    73â†’}
    74â†’
    75â†’export function useLCXL3Device() {
    76â†’  const [state, setState] = useState<LCXL3DeviceState>({
    77â†’    device: null,
    78â†’    isConnected: false,
    79â†’    isInitialized: false,
    80â†’    error: null
    81â†’  });
    82â†’
    83â†’  const deviceRef = useRef<LaunchControlXL3 | null>(null);
    84â†’
    85â†’  useEffect(() => {
    86â†’    const initDevice = async () => {
    87â†’      try {
    88â†’        const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
    89â†’          autoConnect: true,
    90â†’          enableCustomModes: true,
    91â†’          enableLedControl: false
    92â†’        });
    93â†’
    94â†’        device.on('device:ready', () => {
    95â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: true }));
    96â†’        });
    97â†’
    98â†’        device.on('device:error', (error) => {
    99â†’          setState(prev => ({
   100â†’            ...prev,
   101â†’            error: error.message || 'Device error',
   102â†’            isConnected: false
   103â†’          }));
   104â†’        });
   105â†’
   106â†’        await device.initialize();
   107â†’        deviceRef.current = device;
   108â†’
   109â†’        setState({
   110â†’          device,
   111â†’          isConnected: true,
   112â†’          isInitialized: true,
   113â†’          error: null
   114â†’        });
   115â†’      } catch (error) {
   116â†’        setState(prev => ({
   117â†’          ...prev,
   118â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize device',
   119â†’          isInitialized: true
   120â†’        }));
   121â†’      }
   122â†’    };
   123â†’
   124â†’    initDevice();
   125â†’
   126â†’    return () => {
   127â†’      if (deviceRef.current) {
   128â†’        deviceRef.current.disconnect().catch(console.error);
   129â†’      }
   130â†’    };
   131â†’  }, []);
   132â†’
   133â†’  const fetchCurrentMode = async (): Promise<LCXL3CustomMode> => {
   134â†’    if (!state.device || !state.isConnected) {
   135â†’      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Slot 0 is the currently active custom mode
   139â†’    const mode = await state.device.loadCustomMode(0);
   140â†’    return mode;
   141â†’  };
   142â†’
   143â†’  return {
   144â†’    ...state,
   145â†’    fetchCurrentMode
   146â†’  };
   147â†’}
   148â†’\```

   158â†’### Task 2: Convert LCXL3 Mode to CustomMode Format
   159â†’**File**: Create `src/utils/modeConverter.ts`
   160â†’
   161â†’**What to implement**:
   162â†’Utility functions to convert between LCXL3 mode format and our CustomMode format.
   163â†’
   164â†’\```typescript
   165â†’import type { CustomMode, ControlMapping } from '@/types/mode';
   166â†’import type { LCXL3CustomMode } from '@/hooks/useLCXL3Device';
   167â†’import { CONTROL_IDS } from '@/utils/controlMetadata';
   168â†’
   169â†’// Map LCXL3 control IDs to our control IDs
   170â†’const CONTROL_ID_MAP: Record<string, string> = {
   171â†’  'knob1': 'knob-cc13',
   172â†’  'knob2': 'knob-cc14',
   173â†’  'knob3': 'knob-cc15',
   174â†’  // ... add all 48 mappings
   175â†’  'fader1': 'fader-cc5',
   176â†’  'fader2': 'fader-cc6',
   177â†’  // ...
   178â†’  'button1': 'button-cc37',
   179â†’  'button2': 'button-cc38',
   180â†’  // ...
   181â†’};
   182â†’
   183â†’export function lcxl3ModeToCustomMode(lcxl3Mode: LCXL3CustomMode): CustomMode {
   184â†’  const controls: Record<string, ControlMapping> = {};
   185â†’
   186â†’  for (const [lcxl3ControlId, control] of Object.entries(lcxl3Mode.controls)) {
   187â†’    const ourControlId = CONTROL_ID_MAP[lcxl3ControlId];
   188â†’    if (!ourControlId) {
   189â†’      console.warn(`Unknown control ID: ${lcxl3ControlId}`);
   190â†’      continue;
   191â†’    }
   192â†’
   193â†’    controls[ourControlId] = {
   194â†’      id: ourControlId,
   195â†’      type: control.type,
   196â†’      ccNumber: control.cc,
   197â†’      midiChannel: control.channel,
   198â†’      minValue: control.min,
   199â†’      maxValue: control.max,
   200â†’      label: '' // No label in LCXL3 mode, will use default
   201â†’    };
   202â†’  }
   203â†’
   204â†’  return {
   205â†’    name: lcxl3Mode.name || 'Fetched Mode',
   206â†’    description: `Fetched from device on ${new Date().toLocaleString()}`,
   207â†’    version: '1.0.0',
   208â†’    controls,
   209â†’    createdAt: lcxl3Mode.metadata?.createdAt.toISOString() || new Date().toISOString(),
   210â†’    modifiedAt: new Date().toISOString()
   211â†’  };
   212â†’}
   213â†’\```
   214â†’
   215â†’**Success criteria**:
   216â†’- Converts all 48 controls from LCXL3 format to CustomMode format
   217â†’- Handles missing controls gracefully
   218â†’- Preserves control metadata (CC numbers, channels, ranges)

     2â†’
     3â†’**Status**: ğŸŸ¡ IN PROGRESS
     4â†’**Date**: 2025-09-27

     7â†’## Specification Requirements (docs/EDITOR-SPECIFICATION.md)

     9â†’### Feature 6.0: Send and Fetch controls are sensitive to the connection status of the device
    10â†’- [ ] When the device is not attached, the Send and fetch buttons are inactive
    11â†’
    12â†’### Feature 6.1: Users can retrieve the current mode from the device into the edit buffer
    13â†’- [ ] There is a button to the left of the "Send" button labeled "Fetch"
    14â†’- [ ] When the user clicks the "Fetch" button, the system initiates a MIDI transfer of the data in the currently active mode in the device
    15â†’- [ ] The system resets the current edit buffer to factory defaults, then applies the fetched mode data to the current edit buffer
    16â†’- [ ] Per standard operation, the UI is updated to reflect the new state of the edit buffer
    17â†’- [ ] The UI indicates the success or failure of the fetch action

    42â†’
    43â†’**What to implement**:
    44â†’A React hook that manages the LaunchControlXL3 device instance with Web MIDI backend.
    45â†’
    46â†’\```typescript
    47â†’import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
    48â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
    49â†’
    50â†’export interface LCXL3DeviceState {
    51â†’  device: LaunchControlXL3 | null;
    52â†’  isConnected: boolean;
    53â†’  isInitialized: boolean;
    54â†’  error: string | null;
    55â†’}
    56â†’
    57â†’export interface LCXL3CustomMode {
    58â†’  name: string;
    59â†’  controls: Record<string, {
    60â†’    type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    61â†’    channel: number;
    62â†’    cc: number;
    63â†’    min: number;
    64â†’    max: number;
    65â†’    behaviour?: string;
    66â†’  }>;
    67â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: string; behaviour: string }>;
    68â†’  metadata?: {
    69â†’    slot: number;
    70â†’    createdAt: Date;
    71â†’    modifiedAt: Date;
    72â†’  };
    73â†’}
    74â†’
    75â†’export function useLCXL3Device() {
    76â†’  const [state, setState] = useState<LCXL3DeviceState>({
    77â†’    device: null,
    78â†’    isConnected: false,
    79â†’    isInitialized: false,
    80â†’    error: null
    81â†’  });
    82â†’
    83â†’  const deviceRef = useRef<LaunchControlXL3 | null>(null);
    84â†’
    85â†’  useEffect(() => {
    86â†’    const initDevice = async () => {
    87â†’      try {
    88â†’        const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
    89â†’          autoConnect: true,
    90â†’          enableCustomModes: true,
    91â†’          enableLedControl: false
    92â†’        });
    93â†’
    94â†’        device.on('device:ready', () => {
    95â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: true }));
    96â†’        });
    97â†’
    98â†’        device.on('device:error', (error) => {
    99â†’          setState(prev => ({
   100â†’            ...prev,
   101â†’            error: error.message || 'Device error',
   102â†’            isConnected: false
   103â†’          }));
   104â†’        });
   105â†’
   106â†’        await device.initialize();
   107â†’        deviceRef.current = device;
   108â†’
   109â†’        setState({
   110â†’          device,
   111â†’          isConnected: true,
   112â†’          isInitialized: true,
   113â†’          error: null
   114â†’        });
   115â†’      } catch (error) {
   116â†’        setState(prev => ({
   117â†’          ...prev,
   118â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize device',
   119â†’          isInitialized: true
   120â†’        }));
   121â†’      }
   122â†’    };
   123â†’
   124â†’    initDevice();
   125â†’
   126â†’    return () => {
   127â†’      if (deviceRef.current) {
   128â†’        deviceRef.current.disconnect().catch(console.error);
   129â†’      }
   130â†’    };
   131â†’  }, []);
   132â†’
   133â†’  const fetchCurrentMode = async (): Promise<LCXL3CustomMode> => {
   134â†’    if (!state.device || !state.isConnected) {
   135â†’      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Slot 0 is the currently active custom mode
   139â†’    const mode = await state.device.loadCustomMode(0);
   140â†’    return mode;
   141â†’  };
   142â†’
   143â†’  return {
   144â†’    ...state,
   145â†’    fetchCurrentMode
   146â†’  };
   147â†’}
   148â†’\```
   149â†’
   150â†’**Success criteria**:
   151â†’- Hook initializes LaunchControlXL3 device on mount
   152â†’- Tracks connection state
   153â†’- Provides fetchCurrentMode function
   154â†’- Handles errors gracefully
   155â†’
   156â†’---
   157â†’
   158â†’### Task 2: Convert LCXL3 Mode to CustomMode Format
   159â†’**File**: Create `src/utils/modeConverter.ts`
   160â†’
   161â†’**What to implement**:
   162â†’Utility functions to convert between LCXL3 mode format and our CustomMode format.
   163â†’
   164â†’\```typescript
   165â†’import type { CustomMode, ControlMapping } from '@/types/mode';
   166â†’import type { LCXL3CustomMode } from '@/hooks/useLCXL3Device';
   167â†’import { CONTROL_IDS } from '@/utils/controlMetadata';
   168â†’
   169â†’// Map LCXL3 control IDs to our control IDs
   170â†’const CONTROL_ID_MAP: Record<string, string> = {
   171â†’  'knob1': 'knob-cc13',
   172â†’  'knob2': 'knob-cc14',
   173â†’  'knob3': 'knob-cc15',
   174â†’  // ... add all 48 mappings
   175â†’  'fader1': 'fader-cc5',
   176â†’  'fader2': 'fader-cc6',
   177â†’  // ...
   178â†’  'button1': 'button-cc37',
   179â†’  'button2': 'button-cc38',
   180â†’  // ...
   181â†’};
   182â†’
   183â†’export function lcxl3ModeToCustomMode(lcxl3Mode: LCXL3CustomMode): CustomMode {
   184â†’  const controls: Record<string, ControlMapping> = {};
   185â†’
   186â†’  for (const [lcxl3ControlId, control] of Object.entries(lcxl3Mode.controls)) {
   187â†’    const ourControlId = CONTROL_ID_MAP[lcxl3ControlId];
   188â†’    if (!ourControlId) {
   189â†’      console.warn(`Unknown control ID: ${lcxl3ControlId}`);
   190â†’      continue;
   191â†’    }
   192â†’
   193â†’    controls[ourControlId] = {
   194â†’      id: ourControlId,
   195â†’      type: control.type,
   196â†’      ccNumber: control.cc,
   197â†’      midiChannel: control.channel,
   198â†’      minValue: control.min,
   199â†’      maxValue: control.max,
   200â†’      label: '' // No label in LCXL3 mode, will use default
   201â†’    };
   202â†’  }
   203â†’
   204â†’  return {
   205â†’    name: lcxl3Mode.name || 'Fetched Mode',
   206â†’    description: `Fetched from device on ${new Date().toLocaleString()}`,
   207â†’    version: '1.0.0',
   208â†’    controls,
   209â†’    createdAt: lcxl3Mode.metadata?.createdAt.toISOString() || new Date().toISOString(),
   210â†’    modifiedAt: new Date().toISOString()
   211â†’  };
   212â†’}
   213â†’\```
   214â†’
   215â†’**Success criteria**:

     3â†’**Status**: ğŸŸ¡ IN PROGRESS

     6â†’
     7â†’## Specification Requirements (docs/EDITOR-SPECIFICATION.md)
     8â†’
     9â†’### Feature 6.0: Send and Fetch controls are sensitive to the connection status of the device
    10â†’- [ ] When the device is not attached, the Send and fetch buttons are inactive
    11â†’
    12â†’### Feature 6.1: Users can retrieve the current mode from the device into the edit buffer
    13â†’- [ ] There is a button to the left of the "Send" button labeled "Fetch"
    14â†’- [ ] When the user clicks the "Fetch" button, the system initiates a MIDI transfer of the data in the currently active mode in the device
    15â†’- [ ] The system resets the current edit buffer to factory defaults, then applies the fetched mode data to the current edit buffer
    16â†’- [ ] Per standard operation, the UI is updated to reflect the new state of the edit buffer
    17â†’- [ ] The UI indicates the success or failure of the fetch action
    18â†’

    41â†’**File**: Create `src/hooks/useLCXL3Device.ts`
    42â†’
    43â†’**What to implement**:
    44â†’A React hook that manages the LaunchControlXL3 device instance with Web MIDI backend.
    45â†’
    46â†’\```typescript
    47â†’import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
    48â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
    49â†’
    50â†’export interface LCXL3DeviceState {
    51â†’  device: LaunchControlXL3 | null;
    52â†’  isConnected: boolean;
    53â†’  isInitialized: boolean;
    54â†’  error: string | null;
    55â†’}
    56â†’
    57â†’export interface LCXL3CustomMode {
    58â†’  name: string;
    59â†’  controls: Record<string, {
    60â†’    type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    61â†’    channel: number;
    62â†’    cc: number;
    63â†’    min: number;
    64â†’    max: number;
    65â†’    behaviour?: string;
    66â†’  }>;
    67â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: string; behaviour: string }>;
    68â†’  metadata?: {
    69â†’    slot: number;
    70â†’    createdAt: Date;
    71â†’    modifiedAt: Date;
    72â†’  };
    73â†’}
    74â†’
    75â†’export function useLCXL3Device() {
    76â†’  const [state, setState] = useState<LCXL3DeviceState>({
    77â†’    device: null,
    78â†’    isConnected: false,
    79â†’    isInitialized: false,
    80â†’    error: null
    81â†’  });
    82â†’
    83â†’  const deviceRef = useRef<LaunchControlXL3 | null>(null);
    84â†’
    85â†’  useEffect(() => {
    86â†’    const initDevice = async () => {
    87â†’      try {
    88â†’        const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
    89â†’          autoConnect: true,
    90â†’          enableCustomModes: true,
    91â†’          enableLedControl: false
    92â†’        });
    93â†’
    94â†’        device.on('device:ready', () => {
    95â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: true }));
    96â†’        });
    97â†’
    98â†’        device.on('device:error', (error) => {
    99â†’          setState(prev => ({
   100â†’            ...prev,
   101â†’            error: error.message || 'Device error',
   102â†’            isConnected: false
   103â†’          }));
   104â†’        });
   105â†’
   106â†’        await device.initialize();
   107â†’        deviceRef.current = device;
   108â†’
   109â†’        setState({
   110â†’          device,
   111â†’          isConnected: true,
   112â†’          isInitialized: true,
   113â†’          error: null
   114â†’        });
   115â†’      } catch (error) {
   116â†’        setState(prev => ({
   117â†’          ...prev,
   118â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize device',
   119â†’          isInitialized: true
   120â†’        }));
   121â†’      }
   122â†’    };
   123â†’
   124â†’    initDevice();
   125â†’
   126â†’    return () => {
   127â†’      if (deviceRef.current) {
   128â†’        deviceRef.current.disconnect().catch(console.error);
   129â†’      }
   130â†’    };
   131â†’  }, []);
   132â†’
   133â†’  const fetchCurrentMode = async (): Promise<LCXL3CustomMode> => {
   134â†’    if (!state.device || !state.isConnected) {
   135â†’      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Slot 0 is the currently active custom mode
   139â†’    const mode = await state.device.loadCustomMode(0);
   140â†’    return mode;
   141â†’  };
   142â†’
   143â†’  return {
   144â†’    ...state,
   145â†’    fetchCurrentMode
   146â†’  };
   147â†’}
   148â†’\```
   149â†’
   150â†’**Success criteria**:
   151â†’- Hook initializes LaunchControlXL3 device on mount
   152â†’- Tracks connection state
   153â†’- Provides fetchCurrentMode function
   154â†’- Handles errors gracefully

     8â†’
     9â†’### Feature 6.0: Send and Fetch controls are sensitive to the connection status of the device
    10â†’- [ ] When the device is not attached, the Send and fetch buttons are inactive
    11â†’
    12â†’### Feature 6.1: Users can retrieve the current mode from the device into the edit buffer
    13â†’- [ ] There is a button to the left of the "Send" button labeled "Fetch"
    14â†’- [ ] When the user clicks the "Fetch" button, the system initiates a MIDI transfer of the data in the currently active mode in the device
    15â†’- [ ] The system resets the current edit buffer to factory defaults, then applies the fetched mode data to the current edit buffer
    16â†’- [ ] Per standard operation, the UI is updated to reflect the new state of the edit buffer
    17â†’- [ ] The UI indicates the success or failure of the fetch action

    39â†’
    40â†’### Task 1: Create LCXL3 Service Hook
    41â†’**File**: Create `src/hooks/useLCXL3Device.ts`
    42â†’
    43â†’**What to implement**:
    44â†’A React hook that manages the LaunchControlXL3 device instance with Web MIDI backend.
    45â†’
    46â†’\```typescript
    47â†’import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
    48â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
    49â†’
    50â†’export interface LCXL3DeviceState {
    51â†’  device: LaunchControlXL3 | null;
    52â†’  isConnected: boolean;
    53â†’  isInitialized: boolean;
    54â†’  error: string | null;
    55â†’}
    56â†’
    57â†’export interface LCXL3CustomMode {
    58â†’  name: string;
    59â†’  controls: Record<string, {
    60â†’    type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    61â†’    channel: number;
    62â†’    cc: number;
    63â†’    min: number;
    64â†’    max: number;
    65â†’    behaviour?: string;
    66â†’  }>;
    67â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: string; behaviour: string }>;
    68â†’  metadata?: {
    69â†’    slot: number;
    70â†’    createdAt: Date;
    71â†’    modifiedAt: Date;
    72â†’  };
    73â†’}
    74â†’
    75â†’export function useLCXL3Device() {
    76â†’  const [state, setState] = useState<LCXL3DeviceState>({
    77â†’    device: null,
    78â†’    isConnected: false,
    79â†’    isInitialized: false,
    80â†’    error: null
    81â†’  });
    82â†’
    83â†’  const deviceRef = useRef<LaunchControlXL3 | null>(null);
    84â†’
    85â†’  useEffect(() => {
    86â†’    const initDevice = async () => {
    87â†’      try {
    88â†’        const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
    89â†’          autoConnect: true,
    90â†’          enableCustomModes: true,
    91â†’          enableLedControl: false
    92â†’        });
    93â†’
    94â†’        device.on('device:ready', () => {
    95â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: true }));
    96â†’        });
    97â†’
    98â†’        device.on('device:error', (error) => {
    99â†’          setState(prev => ({
   100â†’            ...prev,
   101â†’            error: error.message || 'Device error',
   102â†’            isConnected: false
   103â†’          }));
   104â†’        });
   105â†’
   106â†’        await device.initialize();
   107â†’        deviceRef.current = device;
   108â†’
   109â†’        setState({
   110â†’          device,
   111â†’          isConnected: true,
   112â†’          isInitialized: true,
   113â†’          error: null
   114â†’        });
   115â†’      } catch (error) {
   116â†’        setState(prev => ({
   117â†’          ...prev,
   118â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize device',
   119â†’          isInitialized: true
   120â†’        }));
   121â†’      }
   122â†’    };
   123â†’
   124â†’    initDevice();
   125â†’
   126â†’    return () => {
   127â†’      if (deviceRef.current) {
   128â†’        deviceRef.current.disconnect().catch(console.error);
   129â†’      }
   130â†’    };
   131â†’  }, []);
   132â†’
   133â†’  const fetchCurrentMode = async (): Promise<LCXL3CustomMode> => {
   134â†’    if (!state.device || !state.isConnected) {
   135â†’      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Slot 0 is the currently active custom mode
   139â†’    const mode = await state.device.loadCustomMode(0);
   140â†’    return mode;
   141â†’  };
   142â†’
   143â†’  return {
   144â†’    ...state,
   145â†’    fetchCurrentMode
   146â†’  };
   147â†’}
   148â†’\```
   149â†’
   150â†’**Success criteria**:
   151â†’- Hook initializes LaunchControlXL3 device on mount
   152â†’- Tracks connection state
   153â†’- Provides fetchCurrentMode function
   154â†’- Handles errors gracefully
   155â†’
   156â†’---
   157â†’
   158â†’### Task 2: Convert LCXL3 Mode to CustomMode Format
   159â†’**File**: Create `src/utils/modeConverter.ts`
   160â†’
   161â†’**What to implement**:
   162â†’Utility functions to convert between LCXL3 mode format and our CustomMode format.
   163â†’
   164â†’\```typescript
   165â†’import type { CustomMode, ControlMapping } from '@/types/mode';
   166â†’import type { LCXL3CustomMode } from '@/hooks/useLCXL3Device';
   167â†’import { CONTROL_IDS } from '@/utils/controlMetadata';
   168â†’
   169â†’// Map LCXL3 control IDs to our control IDs
   170â†’const CONTROL_ID_MAP: Record<string, string> = {
   171â†’  'knob1': 'knob-cc13',
   172â†’  'knob2': 'knob-cc14',
   173â†’  'knob3': 'knob-cc15',
   174â†’  // ... add all 48 mappings
   175â†’  'fader1': 'fader-cc5',
   176â†’  'fader2': 'fader-cc6',
   177â†’  // ...
   178â†’  'button1': 'button-cc37',
   179â†’  'button2': 'button-cc38',
   180â†’  // ...
   181â†’};
   182â†’
   183â†’export function lcxl3ModeToCustomMode(lcxl3Mode: LCXL3CustomMode): CustomMode {
   184â†’  const controls: Record<string, ControlMapping> = {};
   185â†’
   186â†’  for (const [lcxl3ControlId, control] of Object.entries(lcxl3Mode.controls)) {
   187â†’    const ourControlId = CONTROL_ID_MAP[lcxl3ControlId];
   188â†’    if (!ourControlId) {
   189â†’      console.warn(`Unknown control ID: ${lcxl3ControlId}`);
   190â†’      continue;
   191â†’    }
   192â†’
   193â†’    controls[ourControlId] = {
   194â†’      id: ourControlId,
   195â†’      type: control.type,
   196â†’      ccNumber: control.cc,
   197â†’      midiChannel: control.channel,
   198â†’      minValue: control.min,
   199â†’      maxValue: control.max,
   200â†’      label: '' // No label in LCXL3 mode, will use default
   201â†’    };
   202â†’  }
   203â†’
   204â†’  return {
   205â†’    name: lcxl3Mode.name || 'Fetched Mode',
   206â†’    description: `Fetched from device on ${new Date().toLocaleString()}`,
   207â†’    version: '1.0.0',
   208â†’    controls,
   209â†’    createdAt: lcxl3Mode.metadata?.createdAt.toISOString() || new Date().toISOString(),
   210â†’    modifiedAt: new Date().toISOString()
   211â†’  };
   212â†’}
   213â†’\```
   214â†’
   215â†’**Success criteria**:
   216â†’- Converts all 48 controls from LCXL3 format to CustomMode format
   217â†’- Handles missing controls gracefully
   218â†’- Preserves control metadata (CC numbers, channels, ranges)
   219â†’
   220â†’---
   221â†’

   223â†’**File**: Modify `src/pages/Editor.tsx`
   224â†’
   225â†’**Changes needed**:
   226â†’1. Import useLCXL3Device hook

   233â†’\```typescript

   235â†’import { lcxl3ModeToCustomMode } from '@/utils/modeConverter';
   236â†’import { Download } from "lucide-react";
   237â†’
   238â†’// In Editor component:

   243â†’    toast.info('Fetching mode from device...');

   246â†’    const fetchedMode = lcxl3ModeToCustomMode(lcxl3Mode);
   247â†’

   249â†’    const defaultControls = initializeDefaultControls();
   250â†’    const mergedControls = {
   251â†’      ...defaultControls,
   252â†’      ...fetchedMode.controls
   253â†’    };

   256â†’      ...fetchedMode,
   257â†’      controls: mergedControls
   258â†’    });

   261â†’  } catch (error) {
   262â†’    const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to fetch mode';
   263â†’    toast.error(`Fetch failed: ${message}`);
   264â†’    console.error('Fetch error:', error);
   265â†’  }
   266â†’};
   267â†’
   268â†’// In JSX (before Send button):
   269â†’<Button
   270â†’  onClick={handleFetch}

   274â†’>
   275â†’  <Download className="w-4 h-4 mr-2" />
   276â†’  Fetch
   277â†’</Button>

   279â†’  disabled={!lcxl3Connected}
   280â†’  size="sm"
   281â†’  className="bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground shadow-glow-secondary"
   282â†’>
   283â†’  <Play className="w-4 h-4 mr-2" />
   284â†’  Send
   285â†’</Button>
   286â†’\```

    40â†’### Task 1: Create LCXL3 Service Hook
    41â†’**File**: Create `src/hooks/useLCXL3Device.ts`
    42â†’
    43â†’**What to implement**:
    44â†’A React hook that manages the LaunchControlXL3 device instance with Web MIDI backend.
    45â†’
    46â†’\```typescript
    47â†’import { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
    48â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
    49â†’
    50â†’export interface LCXL3DeviceState {
    51â†’  device: LaunchControlXL3 | null;
    52â†’  isConnected: boolean;
    53â†’  isInitialized: boolean;
    54â†’  error: string | null;
    55â†’}
    56â†’
    57â†’export interface LCXL3CustomMode {
    58â†’  name: string;
    59â†’  controls: Record<string, {
    60â†’    type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    61â†’    channel: number;
    62â†’    cc: number;
    63â†’    min: number;
    64â†’    max: number;
    65â†’    behaviour?: string;
    66â†’  }>;
    67â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: string; behaviour: string }>;
    68â†’  metadata?: {
    69â†’    slot: number;
    70â†’    createdAt: Date;
    71â†’    modifiedAt: Date;
    72â†’  };
    73â†’}
    74â†’
    75â†’export function useLCXL3Device() {
    76â†’  const [state, setState] = useState<LCXL3DeviceState>({
    77â†’    device: null,
    78â†’    isConnected: false,
    79â†’    isInitialized: false,
    80â†’    error: null
    81â†’  });
    82â†’
    83â†’  const deviceRef = useRef<LaunchControlXL3 | null>(null);
    84â†’
    85â†’  useEffect(() => {
    86â†’    const initDevice = async () => {
    87â†’      try {
    88â†’        const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
    89â†’          autoConnect: true,
    90â†’          enableCustomModes: true,
    91â†’          enableLedControl: false
    92â†’        });
    93â†’
    94â†’        device.on('device:ready', () => {
    95â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: true }));
    96â†’        });
    97â†’
    98â†’        device.on('device:error', (error) => {
    99â†’          setState(prev => ({
   100â†’            ...prev,
   101â†’            error: error.message || 'Device error',
   102â†’            isConnected: false
   103â†’          }));
   104â†’        });
   105â†’
   106â†’        await device.initialize();
   107â†’        deviceRef.current = device;
   108â†’
   109â†’        setState({
   110â†’          device,
   111â†’          isConnected: true,
   112â†’          isInitialized: true,
   113â†’          error: null
   114â†’        });
   115â†’      } catch (error) {
   116â†’        setState(prev => ({
   117â†’          ...prev,
   118â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize device',
   119â†’          isInitialized: true
   120â†’        }));
   121â†’      }
   122â†’    };
   123â†’
   124â†’    initDevice();
   125â†’
   126â†’    return () => {
   127â†’      if (deviceRef.current) {
   128â†’        deviceRef.current.disconnect().catch(console.error);
   129â†’      }
   130â†’    };
   131â†’  }, []);
   132â†’
   133â†’  const fetchCurrentMode = async (): Promise<LCXL3CustomMode> => {
   134â†’    if (!state.device || !state.isConnected) {
   135â†’      throw new Error('Device not connected');
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Slot 0 is the currently active custom mode
   139â†’    const mode = await state.device.loadCustomMode(0);
   140â†’    return mode;
   141â†’  };
   142â†’
   143â†’  return {
   144â†’    ...state,
   145â†’    fetchCurrentMode
   146â†’  };
   147â†’}
   148â†’\```
   149â†’
   150â†’**Success criteria**:
   151â†’- Hook initializes LaunchControlXL3 device on mount
   152â†’- Tracks connection state
   153â†’- Provides fetchCurrentMode function
   154â†’- Handles errors gracefully

   157â†’
   158â†’### Task 2: Convert LCXL3 Mode to CustomMode Format
   159â†’**File**: Create `src/utils/modeConverter.ts`
   160â†’
   161â†’**What to implement**:
   162â†’Utility functions to convert between LCXL3 mode format and our CustomMode format.
   163â†’
   164â†’\```typescript
   165â†’import type { CustomMode, ControlMapping } from '@/types/mode';
   166â†’import type { LCXL3CustomMode } from '@/hooks/useLCXL3Device';
   167â†’import { CONTROL_IDS } from '@/utils/controlMetadata';
   168â†’
   169â†’// Map LCXL3 control IDs to our control IDs
   170â†’const CONTROL_ID_MAP: Record<string, string> = {
   171â†’  'knob1': 'knob-cc13',
   172â†’  'knob2': 'knob-cc14',
   173â†’  'knob3': 'knob-cc15',
   174â†’  // ... add all 48 mappings
   175â†’  'fader1': 'fader-cc5',
   176â†’  'fader2': 'fader-cc6',
   177â†’  // ...
   178â†’  'button1': 'button-cc37',
   179â†’  'button2': 'button-cc38',
   180â†’  // ...
   181â†’};
   182â†’
   183â†’export function lcxl3ModeToCustomMode(lcxl3Mode: LCXL3CustomMode): CustomMode {
   184â†’  const controls: Record<string, ControlMapping> = {};
   185â†’
   186â†’  for (const [lcxl3ControlId, control] of Object.entries(lcxl3Mode.controls)) {
   187â†’    const ourControlId = CONTROL_ID_MAP[lcxl3ControlId];
   188â†’    if (!ourControlId) {
   189â†’      console.warn(`Unknown control ID: ${lcxl3ControlId}`);
   190â†’      continue;
   191â†’    }
   192â†’
   193â†’    controls[ourControlId] = {
   194â†’      id: ourControlId,
   195â†’      type: control.type,
   196â†’      ccNumber: control.cc,
   197â†’      midiChannel: control.channel,
   198â†’      minValue: control.min,
   199â†’      maxValue: control.max,
   200â†’      label: '' // No label in LCXL3 mode, will use default
   201â†’    };
   202â†’  }
   203â†’
   204â†’  return {
   205â†’    name: lcxl3Mode.name || 'Fetched Mode',
   206â†’    description: `Fetched from device on ${new Date().toLocaleString()}`,
   207â†’    version: '1.0.0',
   208â†’    controls,
   209â†’    createdAt: lcxl3Mode.metadata?.createdAt.toISOString() || new Date().toISOString(),
   210â†’    modifiedAt: new Date().toISOString()
   211â†’  };
   212â†’}
   213â†’\```
   214â†’
   215â†’**Success criteria**:
   216â†’- Converts all 48 controls from LCXL3 format to CustomMode format
   217â†’- Handles missing controls gracefully
   218â†’- Preserves control metadata (CC numbers, channels, ranges)
   219â†’

1â†’import type { ControlMapping } from '@/types/mode';
     2â†’
     3â†’export interface ControlInfo {
     4â†’  id: string;
     5â†’  cc: number;
     6â†’  type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
     7â†’  defaultLabel: string;
     8â†’}
     9â†’
    10â†’/**
    11â†’ * Parse control ID and return control information
    12â†’ * Supports formats: "knob-cc13", "fader-cc5", "button-cc37"
    13â†’ */
    14â†’export function getControlInfo(controlId: string): ControlInfo | null {
    15â†’  const match = controlId.match(/^(knob|fader|button)-cc(\d+)$/);
    16â†’  if (!match) {
    17â†’    return null;
    18â†’  }
    19â†’
    20â†’  const [, type, ccStr] = match;
    21â†’  const cc = parseInt(ccStr, 10);
    22â†’
    23â†’  if (isNaN(cc) || cc < 0 || cc > 127) {
    24â†’    return null;
    25â†’  }
    26â†’
    27â†’  // Validate CC numbers are in expected ranges
    28â†’  const validType = type as 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
    29â†’  if (!isValidCCForType(cc, validType)) {
    30â†’    return null;
    31â†’  }
    32â†’
    33â†’  return {
    34â†’    id: controlId,
    35â†’    cc,
    36â†’    type: validType,
    37â†’    defaultLabel: `${type.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + type.slice(1)} ${cc}`
    38â†’  };
    39â†’}
    40â†’
    41â†’/**
    42â†’ * Validate that CC number is in the expected range for control type
    43â†’ */
    44â†’function isValidCCForType(cc: number, type: 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button'): boolean {
    45â†’  switch (type) {
    46â†’    case 'knob':
    47â†’      // Knobs: CC 13-20, 53, 22-36
    48â†’      return (cc >= 13 && cc <= 20) || cc === 53 || (cc >= 22 && cc <= 36);
    49â†’    case 'fader':
    50â†’      // Faders: CC 5-12
    51â†’      return cc >= 5 && cc <= 12;
    52â†’    case 'button':
    53â†’      // Buttons: CC 37-52
    54â†’      return cc >= 37 && cc <= 52;
    55â†’    default:
    56â†’      return false;
    57â†’  }
    58â†’}
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * Get all 48 control definitions
    62â†’ */
    63â†’export function getAllControls(): ControlInfo[] {
    64â†’  const controls: ControlInfo[] = [];
    65â†’
    66â†’  // Knobs: CC 13-20, 53, 22-36 (24 total)
    67â†’  for (let cc = 13; cc <= 20; cc++) {
    68â†’    controls.push({
    69â†’      id: `knob-cc${cc}`,
    70â†’      cc,
    71â†’      type: 'knob',
    72â†’      defaultLabel: `Knob ${cc}`
    73â†’    });
    74â†’  }
    75â†’
    76â†’  // CC 53 knob
    77â†’  controls.push({
    78â†’    id: 'knob-cc53',
    79â†’    cc: 53,
    80â†’    type: 'knob',
    81â†’    defaultLabel: 'Knob 53'
    82â†’  });
    83â†’
    84â†’  for (let cc = 22; cc <= 36; cc++) {
    85â†’    controls.push({
    86â†’      id: `knob-cc${cc}`,
    87â†’      cc,
    88â†’      type: 'knob',
    89â†’      defaultLabel: `Knob ${cc}`
    90â†’    });
    91â†’  }
    92â†’
    93â†’  // Faders: CC 5-12 (8 total)
    94â†’  for (let cc = 5; cc <= 12; cc++) {
    95â†’    controls.push({
    96â†’      id: `fader-cc${cc}`,
    97â†’      cc,
    98â†’      type: 'fader',
    99â†’      defaultLabel: `Fader ${cc}`
   100â†’    });
   101â†’  }
   102â†’
   103â†’  // Buttons: CC 37-52 (16 total)
   104â†’  for (let cc = 37; cc <= 52; cc++) {
   105â†’    controls.push({
   106â†’      id: `button-cc${cc}`,
   107â†’      cc,
   108â†’      type: 'button',
   109â†’      defaultLabel: `Button ${cc}`
   110â†’    });
   111â†’  }
   112â†’
   113â†’  return controls;
   114â†’}
   115â†’
   116â†’/**
   117â†’ * Initialize default control mappings for all 48 controls
   118â†’ */
   119â†’export function initializeDefaultControls(): Record<string, ControlMapping> {
   120â†’  const controls = getAllControls();
   121â†’  const mappings: Record<string, ControlMapping> = {};
   122â†’
   123â†’  for (const control of controls) {
   124â†’    mappings[control.id] = {
   125â†’      id: control.id,
   126â†’      type: control.type,
   127â†’      ccNumber: control.cc,
   128â†’      midiChannel: 1,
   129â†’      minValue: 0,
   130â†’      maxValue: 127,
   131â†’      label: control.defaultLabel
   132â†’    };
   133â†’  }
   134â†’
   135â†’  return mappings;
   136â†’}

     8â†’TypeScript library for controlling the Novation Launch Control XL 3 hardware MIDI controller. Provides complete device control including custom modes, LED management, and advanced control mapping with value transformations.
     9â†’
    10â†’## âœ¨ Features
    11â†’
    12â†’- ğŸ›ï¸ **Complete Device Control** - Full control over all 24 knobs, 8 faders, and 16 buttons
    13â†’- ğŸ”Œ **Platform Agnostic** - Works with Node.js and browser (Web MIDI API)
    14â†’- ğŸ’¡ **LED Management** - Control all button LEDs with colors and animations

    44â†’
    45â†’\```typescript
    46â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
    47â†’
    48â†’// Create and initialize controller
    49â†’const controller = new LaunchControlXL3({
    50â†’  autoConnect: true,
    51â†’  enableLedControl: true,
    52â†’  enableCustomModes: true,
    53â†’});
    54â†’
    55â†’await controller.initialize();
    56â†’
    57â†’// Listen for control changes
    58â†’controller.on('control:change', (controlId, value) => {
    59â†’  console.log(`${controlId}: ${value}`);
    60â†’});

    62â†’// Control LEDs
    63â†’await controller.setLed('FOCUS1', 'GREEN_FULL');

    65â†’
    66â†’// Load custom mode
    67â†’const mode = await controller.loadCustomMode(0);
    68â†’console.log(`Loaded mode: ${mode.name}`);
    69â†’
    70â†’// Clean up when done
    71â†’await controller.cleanup();
    72â†’\```

    74â†’## ğŸ“š Core Concepts
    75â†’
    76â†’### Device Connection
    77â†’
    78â†’The library automatically discovers and connects to the Launch Control XL 3:
    79â†’
    80â†’\```typescript
    81â†’const controller = new LaunchControlXL3({
    82â†’  autoConnect: true,        // Auto-connect on initialization
    83â†’  deviceNameFilter: 'Launch Control XL', // Device name filter
    84â†’  reconnectOnError: true,   // Auto-reconnect on disconnect
    85â†’  maxReconnectAttempts: 5,  // Maximum reconnection attempts
    86â†’});
    87â†’
    88â†’// Manual connection
    89â†’await controller.connect();
    90â†’
    91â†’// Check connection status
    92â†’if (controller.isConnected()) {
    93â†’  const status = controller.getStatus();
    94â†’  console.log(`Firmware: ${status.deviceInfo.firmwareVersion}`);
    95â†’}
    96â†’\```
    97â†’
    98â†’### Control Mapping
    99â†’
   100â†’Map hardware controls to MIDI with advanced transformations:
   101â†’
   102â†’\```typescript
   103â†’// Simple linear mapping
   104â†’controller.mapControl('FADER1', 0, 7, {
   105â†’  min: 0,
   106â†’  max: 127,
   107â†’  behaviour: 'absolute',
   108â†’});
   109â†’
   110â†’// Exponential mapping (perfect for volume)
   111â†’controller.mapControl('FADER2', 0, 11, {
   112â†’  min: 0,
   113â†’  max: 127,
   114â†’  behaviour: 'absolute',
   115â†’  transform: {
   116â†’    type: 'exponential',
   117â†’    curve: 2.5, // Higher = more dramatic curve
   118â†’  },
   119â†’});
   120â†’
   121â†’// Stepped/quantized values
   122â†’controller.mapControl('SEND_A1', 0, 20, {
   123â†’  min: 0,
   124â†’  max: 127,
   125â†’  behaviour: 'absolute',
   126â†’  transform: {
   127â†’    type: 'stepped',
   128â†’    steps: 8, // Quantize to 8 values
   129â†’  },
   130â†’});
   131â†’
   132â†’// Relative encoder modes
   133â†’controller.mapControl('PAN1', 0, 50, {
   134â†’  behaviour: 'relative1', // Two's complement
   135â†’});
   136â†’\```
   137â†’
   138â†’### Value Transformations
   139â†’
   140â†’The library provides 7 value transformation functions:
   141â†’
   142â†’| Transform | Description | Use Case |
   143â†’|-----------|-------------|----------|
   144â†’| **Linear** | Direct 1:1 mapping (default) | General controls |
   145â†’| **Exponential** | Curved response | Volume/filter controls |
   146â†’| **Logarithmic** | Inverse exponential curve | Frequency controls |
   147â†’| **Stepped** | Quantize to discrete steps | Mode/preset selection |
   148â†’| **Toggle** | Binary on/off at threshold | Mute/solo buttons |
   149â†’| **Invert** | Reverse the value range | Reverse faders |
   150â†’| **Bipolar** | Center at zero (-64 to +63) | Pan controls |
   151â†’
   152â†’### LED Control
   153â†’
   154â†’Full control over all 16 button LEDs with colors and effects:
   155â†’
   156â†’\```typescript
   157â†’import { LED_COLOR_VALUES } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
   158â†’
   159â†’// Set static color
   160â†’await controller.setLed('FOCUS1', LED_COLOR_VALUES.GREEN_FULL);
   161â†’
   162â†’// Flash effect
   163â†’await controller.flashLed('CONTROL1', LED_COLOR_VALUES.RED_FULL, 500);
   164â†’
   165â†’// Pulse effect
   166â†’await controller.setLed('FOCUS2', LED_COLOR_VALUES.AMBER_FULL, 'pulse');
   167â†’
   168â†’// Animations
   169â†’controller.startLedAnimation('rainbow', {
   170â†’  type: 'rainbow',
   171â†’  duration: 5000,
   172â†’  controls: ['FOCUS1', 'FOCUS2', 'FOCUS3', 'FOCUS4'],
   173â†’  repeat: 'infinite',
   174â†’});
   175â†’
   176â†’// Turn off all LEDs
   177â†’await controller.turnOffAllLeds();
   178â†’\```
   179â†’
   180â†’Available LED colors:
   181â†’- **Red**: `RED_LOW`, `RED_MEDIUM`, `RED_FULL`
   182â†’- **Amber**: `AMBER_LOW`, `AMBER_MEDIUM`, `AMBER_FULL`
   183â†’- **Yellow**: `YELLOW_LOW`, `YELLOW_FULL`
   184â†’- **Green**: `GREEN_LOW`, `GREEN_MEDIUM`, `GREEN_FULL`
   185â†’- **Off**: `OFF`
   186â†’
   187â†’Available animations:
   188â†’- `rainbow` - Cycle through colors
   189â†’- `chase` - Sequential LED chase
   190â†’- `pulse` - Synchronized pulsing
   191â†’- `flash` - Synchronized flashing
   192â†’- `fade` - Fade between colors
   193â†’- `custom` - Custom animation callback
   194â†’
   195â†’### Custom Modes
   196â†’
   197â†’Manage all 16 device custom modes with full read/write support:
   198â†’
   199â†’\```typescript
   200â†’// Create a new mode
   201â†’const mode = controller.createCustomMode('My DAW Mode');
   202â†’
   203â†’// Configure controls
   204â†’mode.controls['FADER1'] = {
   205â†’  type: 'fader',
   206â†’  channel: 0,
   207â†’  cc: 7,
   208â†’  min: 0,
   209â†’  max: 127,
   210â†’  behaviour: 'absolute',
   211â†’};
   212â†’
   213â†’// Configure LEDs
   214â†’mode.leds['FOCUS1'] = {
   215â†’  color: 'GREEN_FULL',
   216â†’  behaviour: 'static',
   217â†’};
   218â†’
   219â†’// Save to device (slot 0-15)
   220â†’await controller.saveCustomMode(0, mode);
   221â†’
   222â†’// Load from device
   223â†’const loaded = await controller.loadCustomMode(0);
   224â†’
   225â†’// Export to JSON
   226â†’const json = JSON.stringify(mode);
   227â†’
   228â†’// Import from JSON
   229â†’const imported = JSON.parse(json);
   230â†’await controller.saveCustomMode(1, imported);
   231â†’\```
   232â†’

   237â†’\```bash
   238â†’# Install globally

   240â†’
   241â†’# Commands

   243â†’lcxl3 status               # Show device status
   244â†’lcxl3 monitor              # Monitor control changes
   245â†’lcxl3 led-test             # Run LED test pattern
   246â†’lcxl3 load-mode <slot>     # Load custom mode (0-15)
   247â†’
   248â†’# Example workflow
   249â†’lcxl3 connect
   250â†’lcxl3 status
   251â†’lcxl3 monitor              # Move controls to see values
   252â†’lcxl3 led-test             # Test all LEDs

   256â†’## ğŸ“– API Reference
   257â†’
   258â†’### Main Class
   259â†’
   260â†’#### `new LaunchControlXL3(options?)`
   261â†’
   262â†’Creates a new controller instance.
   263â†’
   264â†’**Options:**
   265â†’| Option | Type | Default | Description |
   266â†’|--------|------|---------|-------------|
   267â†’| `midiBackend` | `MidiBackendInterface` | auto-detect | Custom MIDI backend |
   268â†’| `autoConnect` | `boolean` | `true` | Auto-connect on init |
   269â†’| `enableLedControl` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable LED control |
   270â†’| `enableCustomModes` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable custom modes |
   271â†’| `enableValueSmoothing` | `boolean` | `false` | Smooth control values |
   272â†’| `smoothingFactor` | `number` | `3` | Smoothing amount (1-10) |
   273â†’| `deviceNameFilter` | `string` | `'Launch Control XL'` | Device name filter |
   274â†’| `reconnectOnError` | `boolean` | `true` | Auto-reconnect |
   275â†’| `maxReconnectAttempts` | `number` | `5` | Max reconnect tries |
   276â†’
   277â†’### Methods
   278â†’
   279â†’#### Device Control
   280â†’| Method | Description |
   281â†’|--------|-------------|
   282â†’| `initialize()` | Initialize the controller |
   283â†’| `connect()` | Connect to device |
   284â†’| `disconnect()` | Disconnect from device |
   285â†’| `getStatus()` | Get device status |
   286â†’| `isConnected()` | Check connection state |
   287â†’| `cleanup()` | Clean up all resources |
   288â†’
   289â†’#### Control Mapping
   290â†’| Method | Description |
   291â†’|--------|-------------|
   292â†’| `mapControl(id, channel, cc, options)` | Map a control |
   293â†’| `unmapControl(id)` | Unmap a control |
   294â†’| `getControlMapping(id)` | Get control mapping |
   295â†’| `updateControlMapping(id, updates)` | Update mapping |
   296â†’
   297â†’#### LED Control
   298â†’| Method | Description |
   299â†’|--------|-------------|
   300â†’| `setLed(id, color, behaviour?)` | Set LED state |
   301â†’| `turnOffLed(id)` | Turn off specific LED |
   302â†’| `turnOffAllLeds()` | Turn off all LEDs |
   303â†’| `flashLed(id, color, duration?)` | Flash LED once |
   304â†’| `startLedAnimation(id, animation)` | Start animation |
   305â†’| `stopLedAnimation(id)` | Stop animation |
   306â†’
   307â†’#### Custom Modes
   308â†’| Method | Description |
   309â†’|--------|-------------|
   310â†’| `createCustomMode(name)` | Create new mode |
   311â†’| `loadCustomMode(slot)` | Load from device |
   312â†’| `saveCustomMode(slot, mode)` | Save to device |
   313â†’| `exportCurrentAsCustomMode(name)` | Export current state |
   314â†’
   315â†’### Events
   316â†’
   317â†’\```typescript
   318â†’controller.on('device:connected', (device) => { });
   319â†’controller.on('device:disconnected', (reason) => { });
   320â†’controller.on('device:ready', () => { });
   321â†’controller.on('device:error', (error) => { });
   322â†’controller.on('control:change', (id, value, channel) => { });
   323â†’controller.on('control:mapped', (id, mapping) => { });
   324â†’controller.on('mode:changed', (slot, mode) => { });
   325â†’controller.on('mode:loaded', (slot, mode) => { });
   326â†’controller.on('mode:saved', (slot, mode) => { });
   327â†’controller.on('led:changed', (id, color, behaviour) => { });
   328â†’controller.on('midi:in', (message) => { });
   329â†’controller.on('midi:out', (message) => { });
   330â†’\```
   331â†’

   413â†’## ğŸŒ Browser Support
   414â†’
   415â†’As of v2.0.0, `@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3` supports browser environments using the Web MIDI API!
   416â†’
   417â†’### Browser Requirements
   418â†’
   419â†’- Chrome 43+ or Edge 79+ (Chromium-based)
   420â†’- Opera 30+
   421â†’- HTTPS required (or localhost for development)
   422â†’- User permission for MIDI access
   423â†’
   424â†’**Note**: Safari does not currently support Web MIDI API.
   425â†’
   426â†’### Browser Usage Example
   427â†’
   428â†’\```typescript
   429â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
   430â†’
   431â†’// Auto-detects Web MIDI API in browser
   432â†’const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
   433â†’  autoConnect: true,
   434â†’  enableCustomModes: true
   435â†’});
   436â†’
   437â†’// Request permission and initialize
   438â†’await device.initialize();
   439â†’
   440â†’// Use just like in Node.js!
   441â†’device.on('device:connected', () => {
   442â†’  console.log('LCXL3 connected!');
   443â†’});
   444â†’
   445â†’// Load custom mode from device
   446â†’const mode = await device.loadCustomMode(0);
   447â†’console.log('Current mode:', mode);
   448â†’\```

   450â†’### React Example
   451â†’
   452â†’\```typescript
   453â†’import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
   454â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
   455â†’
   456â†’function useLCXL3Device() {
   457â†’  const [device] = useState(() => new LaunchControlXL3({
   458â†’    autoConnect: true,
   459â†’    enableCustomModes: true
   460â†’  }));
   461â†’  const [connected, setConnected] = useState(false);
   462â†’
   463â†’  useEffect(() => {
   464â†’    device.on('device:connected', () => setConnected(true));
   465â†’    device.on('device:disconnected', () => setConnected(false));
   466â†’
   467â†’    device.initialize().catch(console.error);
   468â†’
   469â†’    return () => device.cleanup();
   470â†’  }, [device]);
   471â†’
   472â†’  return { device, connected };
   473â†’}
   474â†’\```
   475â†’
   476â†’### Troubleshooting Browser Usage
   477â†’
   478â†’**Permission Denied**
   479â†’- Web MIDI requires user permission on first access
   480â†’- Must be served over HTTPS (localhost is ok for dev)
   481â†’- Some browsers may block in iframes
   482â†’
   483â†’**Device Not Found**
   484â†’- Ensure LCXL3 is connected before initializing
   485â†’- Check browser's MIDI permission settings
   486â†’- Try refreshing the page after connecting device
   487â†’
   488â†’**SysEx Not Working**
   489â†’- Ensure you're requesting SysEx permission (done automatically)
   490â†’- Some browsers may have additional SysEx restrictions
   491â†’
   492â†’## ğŸ› Troubleshooting
   493â†’
   494â†’### Device Not Found
   495â†’\```bash
   496â†’# Check device is connected
   497â†’ls /dev/midi*  # Linux
   498â†’ls /dev/cu.*   # macOS
   499â†’
   500â†’# Check MIDI permissions
   501â†’# macOS: System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy
   502â†’# Linux: Add user to audio group
   503â†’sudo usermod -a -G audio $USER
   504â†’\```
   505â†’
   506â†’### Permission Errors
   507â†’\```bash
   508â†’# Linux: Add udev rule
   509â†’echo 'SUBSYSTEM=="usb", ATTR{idVendor}=="1235", MODE="0666"' | \
   510â†’  sudo tee /etc/udev/rules.d/50-launch-control.rules
   511â†’sudo udevadm control --reload-rules
   512â†’\```
   513â†’
   514â†’### MIDI Backend Issues
   515â†’\```bash
   516â†’# Try different backends
   517â†’npm install midi    # node-midi
   518â†’npm install jzz     # JZZ
   519â†’npm install easymidi # easymidi
   520â†’\```

    30â†’        ...prev,
    31â†’        error: 'WebMIDI is not supported in this browser. Please use Chrome or Edge.',
    32â†’      }));
    33â†’      return;
    34â†’    }
    35â†’
    36â†’    const manager = new MIDIConnectionManager();
    37â†’
    38â†’    manager
    39â†’      .initialize()
    40â†’      .then(() => {
    41â†’        setState((prev) => ({ ...prev, isInitialized: true, error: null }));
    42â†’
    43â†’        const unsubscribe = manager.onDeviceChange((devices) => {
    44â†’          const xl3Device = manager.findLaunchControlXL3();
    45â†’          setState((prev) => ({
    46â†’            ...prev,
    47â†’            devices,
    48â†’            xl3Device,
    49â†’            isConnected: xl3Device?.isConnected === true,
    50â†’          }));
    51â†’        });
    52â†’
    53â†’        return unsubscribe;
    54â†’      })
    55â†’      .catch((error) => {
    56â†’        setState((prev) => ({
    57â†’          ...prev,
    58â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize MIDI',
    59â†’        }));
    60â†’      });
    61â†’
    62â†’    return () => {
    63â†’      manager.dispose();
    64â†’    };
    65â†’  }, []);
    66â†’
    67â†’  return state;
    68â†’}
```

1â†’import type { CustomMode, ControlMapping } from '@/types/mode';
     2â†’
     3â†’export interface LCXL3Control {
     4â†’  controlId: number;
     5â†’  type?: string;
     6â†’  midiChannel?: number;
     7â†’  channel?: number;
     8â†’  ccNumber?: number;
     9â†’  cc?: number;
    10â†’  minValue?: number;
    11â†’  min?: number;
    12â†’  maxValue?: number;
    13â†’  max?: number;
    14â†’  behavior?: string;
    15â†’  behaviour?: string;
    16â†’}
    17â†’
    18â†’export interface LCXL3CustomMode {
    19â†’  name: string;
    20â†’  controls: Record<string, LCXL3Control> | LCXL3Control[];
    21â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: number | string; behaviour: string }>;
    22â†’  metadata?: {
    23â†’    slot?: number;
    24â†’    createdAt?: Date;
    25â†’    modifiedAt?: Date;
    26â†’  };
    27â†’}
    28â†’
    29â†’const LCXL3_TO_APP_CONTROL_MAP: Record<number, string> = {
    30â†’  0x0D: 'knob-cc13',
    31â†’  0x0E: 'knob-cc14',
    32â†’  0x0F: 'knob-cc15',
    33â†’  0x10: 'knob-cc16',

    35â†’  0x12: 'knob-cc18',
    36â†’  0x13: 'knob-cc19',
    37â†’  0x14: 'knob-cc20',
    38â†’
    39â†’  0x1D: 'knob-cc29',
    40â†’  0x1E: 'knob-cc30',
    41â†’  0x1F: 'knob-cc31',
    42â†’  0x20: 'knob-cc32',
    43â†’  0x21: 'knob-cc33',
    44â†’  0x22: 'knob-cc22',
    45â†’  0x23: 'knob-cc23',
    46â†’  0x24: 'knob-cc24',
    47â†’
    48â†’  0x31: 'knob-cc49',
    49â†’  0x32: 'knob-cc50',
    50â†’  0x33: 'knob-cc51',
    51â†’  0x34: 'knob-cc52',
    52â†’  0x35: 'knob-cc53',
    53â†’  0x36: 'knob-cc25',
    54â†’  0x37: 'knob-cc26',
    55â†’  0x38: 'knob-cc27',
    56â†’
    57â†’  0x4D: 'fader-cc5',
    58â†’  0x4E: 'fader-cc6',
    59â†’  0x4F: 'fader-cc7',
    60â†’  0x50: 'fader-cc8',
    61â†’  0x51: 'fader-cc9',
    62â†’  0x52: 'fader-cc10',
    63â†’  0x53: 'fader-cc11',
    64â†’  0x54: 'fader-cc12',
    65â†’
    66â†’  0x29: 'button-cc41',
    67â†’  0x2A: 'button-cc42',
    68â†’  0x2B: 'button-cc43',
    69â†’  0x2C: 'button-cc44',
    70â†’  0x2D: 'button-cc45',
    71â†’  0x2E: 'button-cc46',
    72â†’  0x2F: 'button-cc47',
    73â†’  0x30: 'button-cc48',
    74â†’
    75â†’  0x39: 'button-cc37',
    76â†’  0x3A: 'button-cc38',
    77â†’  0x3B: 'button-cc39',
    78â†’  0x3C: 'button-cc40',
    79â†’  0x3D: 'button-cc49',
    80â†’  0x3E: 'button-cc50',
    81â†’  0x3F: 'button-cc51',
    82â†’  0x40: 'button-cc52',
    83â†’};
    84â†’
    85â†’export function lcxl3ModeToCustomMode(lcxl3Mode: LCXL3CustomMode): CustomMode {
    86â†’  const controls: Record<string, ControlMapping> = {};
    87â†’
    88â†’  const controlsArray = Array.isArray(lcxl3Mode.controls)
    89â†’    ? lcxl3Mode.controls
    90â†’    : Object.values(lcxl3Mode.controls);
    91â†’
    92â†’  for (const control of controlsArray) {
    93â†’    const ourControlId = LCXL3_TO_APP_CONTROL_MAP[control.controlId];
    94â†’
    95â†’    if (!ourControlId) {
    96â†’      console.warn(`Unknown LCXL3 controlId: 0x${control.controlId.toString(16).toUpperCase()}`);
    97â†’      continue;
    98â†’    }
    99â†’
   100â†’    const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc;
   101â†’    const midiChannel = control.midiChannel ?? control.channel;
   102â†’    const minValue = control.minValue ?? control.min ?? 0;
   103â†’    const maxValue = control.maxValue ?? control.max ?? 127;
   104â†’
   105â†’    if (ccNumber === undefined || midiChannel === undefined) {
   106â†’      console.warn(`Missing CC or channel for controlId: 0x${control.controlId.toString(16)}`);
   107â†’      continue;
   108â†’    }
   109â†’
   110â†’    const controlType = ourControlId.startsWith('knob-')
   111â†’      ? 'knob'
   112â†’      : ourControlId.startsWith('fader-')
   113â†’        ? 'fader'
   114â†’        : 'button';
   115â†’
   116â†’    controls[ourControlId] = {
   117â†’      id: ourControlId,
   118â†’      type: controlType,
   119â†’      ccNumber,
   120â†’      midiChannel: midiChannel + 1,
   121â†’      minValue,
   122â†’      maxValue,
   123â†’      label: ''
   124â†’    };
   125â†’  }
   126â†’
   127â†’  return {
   128â†’    name: lcxl3Mode.name || 'Fetched Mode',
   129â†’    description: `Fetched from device on ${new Date().toLocaleString()}`,
   130â†’    version: '1.0.0',
   131â†’    controls,
   132â†’    createdAt: lcxl3Mode.metadata?.createdAt?.toISOString() || new Date().toISOString(),
   133â†’    modifiedAt: new Date().toISOString()
   134â†’  };
   135â†’}
```

    80â†’/**
    81â†’ * Custom Mode Manager
    82â†’ */
    83â†’export class CustomModeManager extends EventEmitter {
    84â†’  private deviceManager: DeviceManager;
    85â†’  private options: Required<CustomModeManagerOptions>;
    86â†’  private modeCache: Map<number, { mode: CustomMode; timestamp: number }> = new Map();
    87â†’  private pendingOperations: Map<number, Promise<CustomMode>> = new Map();
    88â†’
    89â†’  constructor(options: CustomModeManagerOptions) {
    90â†’    super();
    91â†’
    92â†’    this.deviceManager = options.deviceManager;
    93â†’    this.options = {
    94â†’      deviceManager: options.deviceManager,
    95â†’      autoSync: options.autoSync ?? true,
    96â†’      cacheTimeout: options.cacheTimeout ?? 300000, // 5 minutes
    97â†’    };
    98â†’
    99â†’    this.setupEventHandlers();
   100â†’  }
   101â†’
   102â†’  /**
   103â†’   * Setup event handlers
   104â†’   */
   105â†’  private setupEventHandlers(): void {
   106â†’    // Listen for device connection changes
   107â†’    this.deviceManager.on('device:connected', () => {
   108â†’      if (this.options.autoSync) {
   109â†’        this.syncAllModes().catch(error => {
   110â†’          this.emit('mode:error', error);
   111â†’        });
   112â†’      }
   113â†’    });
   114â†’
   115â†’    this.deviceManager.on('device:disconnected', () => {
   116â†’      this.clearCache();
   117â†’    });
   118â†’  }
   119â†’
   120â†’  /**
   121â†’   * Read a custom mode from the device
   122â†’   */
   123â†’  async readMode(slot: CustomModeSlot): Promise<CustomMode> {
   124â†’    this.validateSlot(slot);
   125â†’
   126â†’    // Check if we have a pending operation for this slot
   127â†’    const pending = this.pendingOperations.get(slot);
   128â†’    if (pending) {
   129â†’      return pending;
   130â†’    }
   131â†’
   132â†’    // Check cache
   133â†’    const cached = this.getCachedMode(slot);
   134â†’    if (cached) {
   135â†’      return cached;
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Create read operation
   139â†’    const operation = this.performReadMode(slot);
   140â†’    this.pendingOperations.set(slot, operation);
   141â†’
   142â†’    try {
   143â†’      const mode = await operation;
   144â†’      this.cacheMode(slot, mode);
   145â†’      this.emit('mode:loaded', slot, mode);
   146â†’      return mode;
   147â†’    } finally {
   148â†’      this.pendingOperations.delete(slot);
   149â†’    }
   150â†’  }
```

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Type definitions for Launch Control XL 3 custom modes
     3â†’ */
     4â†’
     5â†’export type ControlType = 0x00 | 0x05 | 0x09 | 0x0D | 0x19 | 0x25 | 'knob' | 'fader' | 'button';
     6â†’
     7â†’export type ControlBehavior = 'absolute' | 'relative' | 'toggle';
     8â†’
     9â†’export interface Control {
    10â†’  controlId: number;      // Hardware control ID (0x00-0x3F)
    11â†’  controlType: ControlType; // Type determines row/type of control
    12â†’  midiChannel: number;    // 0-15 (0-based)
    13â†’  ccNumber: number;       // CC number 0-127
    14â†’  minValue: number;       // Minimum value (usually 0)
    15â†’  maxValue: number;       // Maximum value (usually 127)
    16â†’  behavior: ControlBehavior;
    17â†’}
    18â†’
    19â†’export interface CustomMode {
    20â†’  name: string;           // Mode name (max 8 chars)
    21â†’  controls: Record<string, ControlMapping>;    // Control mappings by ID
    22â†’  labels?: Map<number, string>;  // Control labels by ID
    23â†’  colors?: Map<number, number>;  // Control colors by ID
    24â†’  leds?: Map<number, { color: number; behaviour: string }>; // LED mappings
    25â†’  metadata?: {
    26â†’    name?: string;
    27â†’    description?: string;
    28â†’    version?: string;
    29â†’    [key: string]: any;
    30â†’  };
    31â†’  slot?: number;          // Mode slot (0-15)
    32â†’}
    33â†’
    34â†’export interface CustomModeMessage {
    35â†’  type: 'custom_mode_response';
    36â†’  manufacturerId: number[];
    37â†’  slot: number;           // Target slot (0-15)
    38â†’  name?: string;
    39â†’  controls: Control[];

    41â†’  data: number[];         // Complete message bytes
    42â†’}
    43â†’
    44â†’export interface ColorMapping {
    45â†’  controlId: number;

    47â†’  behaviour?: string; // LED behavior: 'static', 'flash', 'pulse'
    48â†’}
    49â†’
    50â†’export interface ControlMapping {
    51â†’  controlId?: number; // Optional - can use string keys in Record instead
    52â†’  type?: ControlType; // Optional control type
    53â†’  controlType?: ControlType; // Legacy compatibility
    54â†’  midiChannel?: number; // Required OR use 'channel' alternative
    55â†’  ccNumber?: number; // Required OR use 'cc' alternative
    56â†’  cc?: number; // Alternative CC property
    57â†’  channel?: number; // Alternative channel property
    58â†’  minValue?: number; // Minimum value (default 0)
    59â†’  maxValue?: number; // Maximum value (default 127)
    60â†’  min?: number; // Alternative min property
    61â†’  max?: number; // Alternative max property
    62â†’  behavior?: ControlBehavior;
    63â†’  behaviour?: string; // Alternative spelling
    64â†’  transform?: string | ((value: number) => number); // Value transformation

     2â†’import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@oletizi/launch-control-xl3';
     3â†’import type { LCXL3CustomMode } from '@/utils/modeConverter';
     4â†’
     5â†’export interface LCXL3DeviceState {
     6â†’  device: LaunchControlXL3 | null;
     7â†’  isConnected: boolean;
     8â†’  isInitialized: boolean;
     9â†’  error: string | null;
    10â†’}
    11â†’
    12â†’export function useLCXL3Device() {
    13â†’  const [state, setState] = useState<LCXL3DeviceState>({
    14â†’    device: null,
    15â†’    isConnected: false,
    16â†’    isInitialized: false,
    17â†’    error: null
    18â†’  });
    19â†’
    20â†’  const deviceRef = useRef<LaunchControlXL3 | null>(null);
    21â†’
    22â†’  useEffect(() => {
    23â†’    const initDevice = async () => {
    24â†’      try {
    25â†’        const device = new LaunchControlXL3({
    26â†’          autoConnect: true,
    27â†’          enableCustomModes: true,
    28â†’          enableLedControl: false
    29â†’        });
    30â†’
    31â†’        device.on('device:ready', () => {
    32â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: true }));
    33â†’        });
    34â†’
    35â†’        device.on('device:disconnected', () => {
    36â†’          setState(prev => ({ ...prev, isConnected: false }));
    37â†’        });
    38â†’
    39â†’        device.on('device:error', (error) => {
    40â†’          setState(prev => ({
    41â†’            ...prev,
    42â†’            error: error.message || 'Device error',
    43â†’            isConnected: false
    44â†’          }));
    45â†’        });
    46â†’
    47â†’        await device.initialize();
    48â†’        deviceRef.current = device;
    49â†’
    50â†’        setState({
    51â†’          device,
    52â†’          isConnected: device.isConnected(),
    53â†’          isInitialized: true,
    54â†’          error: null
    55â†’        });
    56â†’      } catch (error) {
    57â†’        setState(prev => ({
    58â†’          ...prev,
    59â†’          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to initialize device',
    60â†’          isInitialized: true
    61â†’        }));
    62â†’      }
    63â†’    };
    64â†’
    65â†’    initDevice();
    66â†’
    67â†’    return () => {
    68â†’      if (deviceRef.current) {
    69â†’        deviceRef.current.disconnect().catch(console.error);
    70â†’      }
    71â†’    };
    72â†’  }, []);
    73â†’
    74â†’  const fetchCurrentMode = async (): Promise<LCXL3CustomMode> => {
    75â†’    if (!state.device || !state.isConnected) {
    76â†’      throw new Error('Device not connected');
    77â†’    }
    78â†’
    79â†’    // Slot 0 is the currently active custom mode
    80â†’    const mode = await state.device.loadCustomMode(0);
    81â†’    return mode;
    82â†’  };
    83â†’
    84â†’  return {
    85â†’    ...state,
    86â†’    fetchCurrentMode
    87â†’  };
    88â†’}
